subject: Programming
title: Psychological Safety in Teams
description: A micro-lesson that makes Psychological Safety in Teams usable.

hook.text: Google studied its best teams and found one factor mattered above all: psychological safety.

buildup.text: Safe teams let members ask questions, admit mistakes, and propose ideas without fear of punishment.

discovery.text: When people feel safe, they report bugs earlier, ask for help sooner, and take creative risks.

twist.text: One dismissive comment in a code review can destroy safety for months. Trust is fragile.

climax.text: The best code comes from teams where everyone feels safe enough to say 'I don't understand.'

punchline.text: Safe teams build better software, period.

quiz.question: What did Google's research find was the top factor in team effectiveness?
